column3: Rays pitcher Matt Garza left the game due to an injured arm

$Close play at 2B on attempted force; Lopez lost Beltre's throw in lights and ball went into RF; ruling was that runner beat throw and error allowed advances to home and 3B; therefore, no assist for Beltre on 'dropped catch' error

$on the dribbler down the 1B line, Halladay picked up the ball when he thought it rolled foul and then argued the fair call with HP umpire Mike DiMuro
ej,arnsb001,C,dimum901,Balls and strikes $Blue Jays coach Arnsberg ejected by HP umpire DiMuro for arguing balls and strikes
ej,leagb001,P,dimum901,Intentional HBP $Pitcher League ejected by HP umpire DiMuro for intentionally hitting Navarro
Debut game for Brooks Conrad
$Indians second baseman Asdrubal Cabrera left the game due to an injured foot/ankle

ej,maddj801,M,mealj901,Double play call after overthrow $Teixeira's throw was wide and retrieved by Kendrick, who tagged Upton before he returned to the bag; 1B umpire Jerry Meals ruled that Upton had turned toward second and called him out; Rays Manager Joe Maddon argued with Meals and crew chief Gary Darling and was ejected by Meals
Rays catcher Dioner Navarro left the game due to an injured leg
Orioles third baseman Melvin Mora left the game due to an injured leg
$Orioles pitcher Jeremy Guthrie yelled at HP umpire Sam Holbrook as he left the game, talking about the strike zone

ej,hernr002,P,holbs901,Balls and strikes $Orioles catcher Ramon Hernandez requested HP umpire Sam Holbrook to check with 3B umpire Chad Fairchild on the possible swing by Akinori Iwamura on the second pitch; it was ruled no swing and Hernandez said some things to Holbrook; Holbrook told Hernandez to throw the ball back to pitcher Fernando Cabrera and then the argument escalated with the ultimate result that Hernandez was ejected by Holbrook
a fan reached over the wall and caught the ball; interference

replay,9,rodra001,NYA,relic901,STP01,F,N,I,,H $the ball went over the LF fence just inside the line but higher than the pole; after the ball was ruled fair, Rays manager Joe Madden asked about the call; the umpires huddled and then crew chief Charlie Reliford went into the visiting team dugout to watch a replay; Reliford upheld the call; this was the first use of the replay capability six days after it was instituted
$Bay's fly ball landed in the 'C' ring catwalk for a ground rule home run
Debut game for Mitch Talbot

replay,4,penac001,TBA,davig901,STP01,I,Y,I,,H $the ball was ruled in play; crew chief Gerry Davis watched the replay and overturned the call to a home run, the first such reversal in the history of instant replay and the third review
